page.title: 01W. Grove an Introduction
page.content: This area is mainly used for mixed farming, but has a small village, Denchworth, and Grove a 20th century residential section. Denchworth is a typical dormant village, while Grove is gradually developing its own amenities instead of being so dependent, as formerly, on Wantage; although there are still many closely related interests, W.Grove has about 4,500 people and Denchworth 130. Denchworth has thatched, stonebuilt cottages, a manor house, a medieaval church, an inn, but no amenities. W.Grove has a modern church, primary school, two recreation grounds, new small industries, a community centre and is near shops and other amenities. The area is flat, moderately fertile but unremarkable but shows great contrast between the two villages. {
